pv3199.lib.java.math

Class PVMath

  • java.lang.Object
    • pv3199.lib.java.math.PVMath

  • public final class PVMath
extends Object
    Intended to be an extension of the Math class. Supports the Java SDK's Byte, Short, Integer, Long, Float, and Double classes, in addition to this library's ComplexNumber class. All operations are performed using the Java SDK's Math class implementation if the input is valid for such method signatures and bounds. For example, calling PVMath.acos(1) will call Math.acos(1) and return a value of 0.0; however PVMath.acos(2) will not call Math.acos(2) as that will not be a real number. Instead PVMath's implementation of the inverse cosine is utilized.

      • ACCEPTED_TYPES_COMPARATOR

        private static final Comparator<Class<? extends Number>> ACCEPTED_TYPES_COMPARATOR
        Comparator used to sort the classes; sorts based on the name of the class defined by Class.getName(). Used to binary search the array of accepted types for checking if a data type is accepted by this Math class.
        See Also:
        isAccepted(Class)

      • abs

        public static Number abs(Number x)
        Parameters:

      • acos

        public static Number acos(Number x)
        Takes the inverse cosine of a number. The inverse cosine of a number is obtained by the following: acos(x) = pi / 2 + iln(ix + sqrt(1 - x^2)). The result is complex when the input is complex or if the input is not in the range [-1, 1].
        Parameters:
        x - - a number.
        Returns:
        the inverse cosine of the number (possibly a ComplexNumber).

      • acosh

        public static Number acosh(Number x)
        Takes the inverse hyperbolic cosine of a number. The inverse hyperbolic cosine of a number is obtained by the following: acosh(x) = ln(sqrt(x-1) * sqrt(x+1) + x). The result is complex when the input is complex or if the input is not in the range [1, infinity].
        Parameters:
        x - - a number.
        Returns:
        the inverse hyperbolic cosine of the number (possibly a ComplexNumber).

      • asin

        public static Number asin(Number x)
        Takes the inverse sine of a number. The inverse sine of a number is obtained by the following: asin(x) = -i * ln(ix + sqrt(1 - x^2)). The result is complex when the input is complex or if the input is not in the range [-1, 1].
        Parameters:
        x - - a number.
        Returns:
        the inverse sine of the number (possibly a ComplexNumber).

      • asinh

        public static Number asinh(Number x)
        Takes the inverse hyperbolic sine of a number. The inverse hyperbolic sine of a number is obtained by the following: asinh(x) = ln(x + sqrt(x^2 + 1)). The result is complex when the input is complex.
        Parameters:
        x - - a number.
        Returns:
        the inverse hyperbolic sine of the number (possibly a ComplexNumber).

      • atan

        public static Number atan(Number x)
        Takes the inverse tangent of a number. The inverse tangent of a number is obtained by the following: atan(x) = i/2 * ln((1-xi)/(1+xi)). The result is complex when the input is complex.
        Parameters:
        x - - a number.
        Returns:
        the inverse tangent of the number (possibly a ComplexNumber).

      • atanh2

        public static Number atanh2(Number y,
                            Number x)
        Takes the inverse tangent of two numbers composing a vector.
        Parameters:
        y - - the y component.
        x - - the x component.
        Returns:
        the inverse tangent of the vector provided (possibly a ComplexNumber).
        See Also:
        atan(Number)

      • atanh

        public static Number atanh(Number x)
        Takes the inverse hyperbolic tangent of a number. The inverse hyperbolic tangent of a number is obtained by the following: atanh(x) = 1/2 * ln((1+x)/(1-x)). The result is complex when the input is complex or not in the range (-1, 1).
        Parameters:
        x - - a number.
        Returns:
        the inverse hyperbolic tangent of the number (possibly a ComplexNumber).

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the cube root of the number (possibly a ComplexNumber).

        public static Number cos(Number x)
        Takes the cosine of a number. The cosine of a number is obtained by the following: cos(a+bi) = cos(a)cosh(b) - isin(a)sinh(b). The result is complex if the input is complex.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the cosine of the number (possibly a ComplexNumber).

        Returns:

      • log

        public static Number log(Number x)

        Parameters:
        x - - a number.
        Returns:
        the natural logarithm of the number (possibly a ComplexNumber).

        Parameters:
        x - - a number.

      • primes

        public static List<Integer> primes(int n)
        Generates a list of prime numbers in the range [2,n) modeled after the Sieve of Eratosthenes algorithm.
        Parameters:
        n - the maximum possible prime number.
        Returns:
        a list of prime numbers in the range [2,n)

      • summation

        public static Number summation(DoubleFunction<Number> function,
                               double start,
                               double end)
        Sums up a sequence of numbers; essentially mimics summation functions. Each iteration is incremented by exactly 1, so calling summation(function, 0, 3) is equivalent to summation(function, 0, 3.4). Kahan's Summation Algorithm is utilized to reduce numerical errors.
        Parameters:
        function - - the function applied to each summation iteration.
        start - - the starting bound (inclusive).
        end - - the ending bound (inclusive).
        Returns:
        the sum of the sequence of numbers provided by a function and two bounds.

      • stdDeviation

        public static Number stdDeviation(Number... values)
        Finds the standard deviation amongst a set of numbers. Utilizes the Discrete Random Variable method (see this wikipedia page for more information)
        Parameters:
        values - - the set of numbers.
        Returns:
        the standard deviation amongst the set of numbers
